Reviews.Title: “Surprised By Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: I was last minute looking for a room in Boston. The hotel prices were expensive. I stumbled across The Copley House on Booking.com. It was around £90 ($110) for a "medium studio". We really just wanted a place with a shower and bed for the night. The reviews were mixed and we decided after hours of searching the hotel websites, that this was the best option. My friend and I walked to the location from the bus station. It was about 45-55 minute walk with luggage (backpack and suitcase). I would say if you have alot of luggage, don't walk it. Google said it was 36 minutes. We went to the Reception and were told our studio was located in a different building. There was a person ready to drop us by van. It was literally just round the corner from the building with the Reception. The studio was in the basement and was warm and cozy. There was a lovely big bed and a sofa bed, kitchenette area and small bathroom with shower. The shower was boiling hot on the first day for me but ok for my friend. It seemed fine the next day. The bed was very comfy. It was a nice location and close to the concert venue. Something to watch out for - make a note of the door number when you leave the building. Our studio was located inside a house with lots of studios on a street with lots of identical front doors! It is easy to forgot which set of steps leads up to the building with your studio in it! I would stay in this studio again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: pyanez
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience, don't go there, no heater, no service, no information, no blankets, the cold win pass through the windows, impossible to talk with some one, waste of money the experience. The owner, doesn't like to talk, to improve, to find solution. Noise room close to avenue, impossible to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Location the only positive, absolutely no security”
Reviews.Author: tower89
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here recently, and this place has several flaws. At first glance the room looked ok, but on closer inspection we noticed window sills rotting and paint peeling from the walls, cupboard draws that fall out when you open them and dirty bedsheets and carpet. In reality, the room was completely disgusting. The worst aspect of this place is the complete lack of security at night. Our room was the one directly behind the office, but this means nothing when there is no one there after business hours, and the front door is left completely unlocked. On our last night, people appeared to break into our room from the back window, and after we tried repeated to call the contact number left on the door without response, we left out of concern for our own safety. When I finally made contact with the manager he was totally unhelpful and couldn't have cared less about our concerns. We strongly advise everyone to stay away from this place, unless you want to feel completely unsafe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming brownstone house, convenient location, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kasalamd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends while attending a convention at Hynes. Chose it online for its convenient location (1 block away from Prudential Center, a convenience store and T station), listed amenities and relatively lower price than most hotels in neighborhood. It's actually not just 1 house but rather, a series of row brownstone townhouses with several rooms in the very quaint and charming Back Bay district. Simple amenities but comfortable enough, a bit dated, could use some refurbishing, certainly not new or 5 star class but clean and decent. Cellphone and Wi-fi signals were strong. Staff was courteous, friendly and very helpful, specially in bringing our luggage up and down the crickety wooden stairs. I'd say good value for money in this area!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GlenJMart
Reviews.Content: Great location for sight seeing in the Back Bay of Boston. The rooms are very simple so don't expect much even though the price is what close to what you might pay for a more posh hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: BristolKiki
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are more like separate apartments so it is really good if you want a bit more privacy/independence. Our room (which I think was a medium suite) had a seating area, dining area, kitchen and massive bed. We were in the building on St Stephen's Street and we heard very little noise from the other rooms. The surrounding area was residential and really nice, quiet and felt safe. It was also near to shops (including the Prudential Centre) and two subway stations. Having looked around we found this hotel to be cheaper than a lot of others and, based on the quality of the room and the surrounding area, I think it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: momof4Wi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here (room 102) with a roommate while attending a conference. Our room was clean (apart from the caulking around the bath tub, a minor issue for me) and well equipped. It's unusual to see wood floors in a hotel and that definitely added to the charm. It felt more like staying in a family home. The downside was that you can hear movement in the room above (chairs scraping, water running in the bathroom) but as I was up at around the same time as our upstairs neighbors anyway, it was not an issue. If you are sensitive to background noise or intend to sleep in, this may not be the place for you. The bathroom was bigger than a typical hotel bathroom, Wi-Fi signal was excellent. I couldn't get a cell phone signal, maybe because our room was downstairs from the main floor (not basement level; we had 2 large living room windows). My roommate's cell phone worked just fine, though. The location can't be beat - a 7 Eleven just down the street, around the corner from the metro, and one block from the mall at the Prudential Center. The reception staff were helpful and friendly. I did call a few times before my arrival to try to secure a room in the 239 Newton St building and that seemed to work. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay in beautiful Back Bay, friendly staff and cosy studios”
Reviews.Author: Bex_Surrey
Reviews.Content: A group of friends -11- in total stayed at Copley House for 5 nights. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Rooms are very cosy, charming and clean, nothing fancy but really convenient, affordable and clean accommodation in central Boston. Highly recommended for a group of friends!!!!

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: I am astounded at the other reviews regarding this property! My husband and I booked for 5 nights in 11/2010. On arrival 26/10/2011 we were allocated a 'last minute' room. After much 'noise making' our room was changed to a room of minimal improved standard. The rooms are not serviced approprietly, towels are thread bare, linen on bed jaded. Furniture is old, tired and the carpet is extremely dirty. Airconditioner when working poured water onto furniture. Bathroom has stagnant odour. WiFi access is limited to NON existent. The only plus to this establishment is that it is located in a prime position!

Reviews.Title: “Classy urban”
Reviews.Author: Moonspring
Reviews.Content: Back Bay brownstone--what more could you want if you're tired of the corporate same-ness of hotels? This was conveniently situated for the Boston sightseeing we wanted to do with the kids. "T" locations (subway stations) and shopping were nearby, so we parked our car in a pay garage (commercial, not hotel) and used public transit and our feet. The brownstone accommodations consisted of a spacious and tasteful living room with fireplace (nonworking), pull-out couch, dining table, kitchen (oven, microwave, toaster oven and coffee maker), plasma screen TV, free WiFi, and a separate bathroom (with thick towels!). Decor was generally tasteful (nice colors, woodwork, high ceilings), but the bathroom wasn't updated and there was a shortage of electric outlets for laptops and even for the bedroom lamp and clock (!). The brownstone has just accommodations, no pool, business center, fitness center, etc., but if we wanted those things, we would have gone to the corporate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place for good price”
Reviews.Author: Nessa9911
Reviews.Content: stayed 2 nights in copley house. very nice room. clean with simple but pleasent furnishng. With kichenette. Good area for siteseeing. near trains and buses. We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need For a Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: ShyFrost
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Copley House and I figured that I should write a review. This is of course not your typical hotel, as they are actually apartments that you are renting for the length of your stay. Oddly enough, both times, I got apt #501, I think that it may be kismet or something. The apt is a small studio with just enough room for two people. The first time it was me and a friend and the second time, I was alone. The room is very clean and spacious and the furniture is not the most modern, but I found everything to be clean and the bed was comfy. This room is right on the first floor, so you can hear the street noises and see people walking by and such, but that is why I like it... hey, I'm a New Yorker and I like noise and people! :) Check in was very quick and efficent and they give you nice map of the city as well as the neighborhodd in wich you are staying in with things such as the lanydry and supermarkets pointed out so that you can prepare your own meals and such. A great location to the subway or bus lines and the city is very walkable as advertised. Really, it's not a five star hotel, but for the price and the location (which is in a very sweet, down to Earth neighborhood with tree lined streets) you can beat it! :)

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled by the price, stay away”
Reviews.Author: Jelajela
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms through hotels.com, upon arriving at the Copley House they didn't want to honor the rate from our reservation. It took over 40 minutes for the manager to finally agree to honor the reservation -- she blamed the "mistake" on an employee that wasn't present. After that ordeal we were walked about four blocks, dragging our suitcases, to the building where our rooms were located. The rooms were dirty and of very poor quality, ie. broken tiles, leaky faucets, blinds that didn't close, exposed wires, outlets that didn't work, musty closets, old mattresses, and the key to one of the rooms didn't work, so we were given a master key! Imagine, we had access to ALL other rooms -- where other guests were staying -- for two days. The Copley House is conviniently located and cheap, but you WILL get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: broadwayshowfan
Reviews.Content: I had called ahead to make sure we could drop off bags before the office opened in the morning and was assured someone would be there all hours to help us. We took a bus overnight and so we got there before the office opened. When we got there we called the number as directed and the person who answered said someone from the front office would be there soon - but it was pouring rain out. Eventually he let us in and the front office person arrived about 5 minutes or so later. We were then easily able to drop off bags and pay. This was a great location near T stops, the Back Bay station, places to eat and walk, etc. In just a few minutes we were right near all the best Boston attractions. The room was well-equipped and we used the fully stocked kitchen to make breakfast. There was a toaster oven, microwave, small fridge, utensils and cookware, coffee pot, etc. It was so nice to be able to use the kitchen and not have to eat out all the time. The bathroom was nice but a little small/cramped. We initially had some trouble with the cable and the internet, but they helped us fix both. We were never able to get the DVD player to work. The room was decently clean, though the carpet was a little dingy and there were definitely some old stains on the bed linens. The only strange thing was we found a dead cockroach about an hour before we checked out. Overall it was a nice room and made any time in the hotel room easy, livable and comfortable, thanks to the kitchen and comfortable furniture/amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bowse
Reviews.Content: At first I was surprised that it wasn't all the same building- our 'apartment' ended up being a bit further down the street. But it was fine, bed was ok and was made each day. Bathroom is basic as is kitchenette- useful for having fridge and crockery so we could have cereal for breakfast- Don't think I'd like to cook meals in it, although you could. Its more of an ensuite bedroom witha kitchenette and a table than an apartment but it was cheap. It's in a great location- Back Bay is a fun area particularly around Newbury Street. And you can see the apartment from the top of the prudential building! There had been some kind of lack of communication between Booking.com and copley House but they were able to sort it out and find us a parking place (eventually- worth telling them this when you book) Back bay is not car friendly! Oh air conditioning is a window unit- which took us 2 night to properly get the nack of- had quite an uncomfortable sleep til we worked it out. Made us ensure our next overnight had it built in and thermostatically controlled.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations for our family”
Reviews.Author: Travelfun2011_0506
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for our family to stay while sight-seeing in Boston. It's not far from MBTA rail stop, so it was easy for us to get around. Our rooms were clean; we loved having a kitchen available. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about those fancy hotel chains”
Reviews.Author: mewantfood3
Reviews.Content: This place has it all, comfy apartments with all amenities hotel offer - hair dryer cable, ful kitchen and it is in such an interesting historic neighborhood. Right next to everything! And cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and neat, lacking customer service”
Reviews.Author: thekaps4
Reviews.Content: Great location and clean rooms. I was in a one bedroom suite with two adults and 3 teenagers. The bed was comfortable, the pull out sofa was *very* uncomfortable. The bedding that was provided for the pullout sofa was inadequate, only a blanket and no bedspread or comforter, my kids froze. I called the next morning for a comforter or extra blankets plus an aerobed and when we got to the room that evening nothing had been placed in the room. Also we were not used to city noise, the windows were not new and thus not soundproofed and we were able to hear people talking in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money, Comfortable accomodation, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Karan_Boston
Reviews.Content: I had to find accommodation for my parents who were coming to visit me in Boston. After a lot of looking around i found this place which was reasonably priced and had the comfort of home. I personally think a apartment is better than a hotel. So here i had the comfort of an apartment and convenience of a hotel. It is close to my university and minutes of walking from all major locations. There is also a seven eleven around the corner which helps. All in all great experience

Reviews.Title: “No appology, no help!”
Reviews.Author: vstar9090
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation a couple of months in advance for a large studio at Copley House. When I tried to confirm my booking, they would not reply to emails or return my phone calls. After multiple attempts to contact them, they eventually informed me they had lost my reservation. No appology, no help! I was lucky enough to find other accomodation during a peak time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but don't come with too much expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Sandy9422
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and me stayed 2 nights at the Copley Hpuse for 80$/night from december 30th and 31st. This hotel is well located right next to the prudential mall and copley square, a 25 min walk to Boston Comon and 40 min walk to the Aquarium. It is also very close to a T station if you want to take public transportation. We booked the small studio through priceline. The room was located on the 3rd floor (no elevator or staff to bring the luggage be warned) and had a fully equipped kitchenette and a double bed. The room was very small and old but clean and the windows are not perfectly soundproofed so if you are not used to city sounds you might want to skip on this one. The building itself looks very nice inside and out and is located in a very nice neighborhood. The parking is 10$ for the whole stay which is very good compared to the 25$ and up/day they charge in most of Boston's hotels. You also have free internet. I would recommend this hotel to open-minded not too needy tourists who don't want to pay a fortune to stay downtown. If you like chain-style hotels and don't like to walk or take the subway, the Copley House is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting days in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Margot7510
Reviews.Content: We came from Paris to spend a week in Boston. The appartment we had at Copley House was very convenient and confortable. We enjoyed the city as if we were part of it, being able to go easily everywhere and to rest when needed. It is THE ideal solution for enjoying a big city like Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at well located place with character”
Reviews.Author: JamesJimJimmy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, found the place to be clean and the staff nice. Location is excellent. The less impressive aspects were an outdated bathroom and tatty hall/staircase. However, my comfortable room made me feel very much at home. I would recommend this to those averse to bland corporate hotels, but not to those who want McDonalds-style predictability at the expense of character. Not cheap, but location justifies the price largely. I note a number of horror one star reviews on TP relating to a room or rooms not in the main building but a block or so away. I stayed in 107 above in the same building as reception, but it seems the other location may be leading to the poor reviews. I would suggest to the management that they don't use a room which is compromising their online reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Stryker_10
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Copley House (which was very late) the office was closed, however, there late night checkin proceedure was so easy and convenient I was in my apt. within a few minutes. I was able to pay my bill the following day. The service I received was so refreshing, The manager was very pleasant - I have not always received that from other hotel employees. My room was clean, all appliances were clean (the apt. came fully furnished with everything someone would need for a weeks stay). I was very satisfied with the service I received and would recommend The Copley House to anyone visiting Boston for business or pleasure. Also, great location - convenient to HinesConvention Center, as well as other shops and fooderies.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: JoJoXXX2000
Reviews.Content: We were really amazed by the location in a very safe area near the Prudential mall in Backbay at walking distance to Universities and downtown area. Apartments are very spacious and offer comfort, quitness and free WIFi access. I liked the equipped kitchen that enabled us to cook quick meals, especially breakfast in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: johngabr
Reviews.Content: Hello Travelers: I was in Boston during the Thanksgiving holiday to visit family and friends, and chose to stay the Copley House. My friends and family live in the South End/Back Bay area of Boston, and even though I was invited to stay with them in their homes, I chose the privacy and convenience of Copley House. I arrived after a long flight on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, and was cordially greeted by the staff, who kindly upgraded my accomodations to a beautiful one bedroom apartment on West Newton Street. Having the one bedroom apartment with a fully equipped kitchen allowed me to prepare most of my meals during my stay (with the exception of Thanksgiving dinner) in my apartment. I flew back home on Sunday night, and before doing so, had a pleasant conversation with Joe Coppola, the proprietor of the Copley House. I'm a return visitor to the Copley House, and this last stay was as wonderful, convenient and affordable as the previous stays. I plan to return to Boston sometime next summer, and have already booked my reservation in advance, as summer is the high season for Copley House. I highly recommend Copley House to anyone visiting Boston. It's convenient, affordable, clean, with a real friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant return visit”
Reviews.Author: Ted033
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Copley House again after an absence of a few years..and again was very content with my stay.The location cant be beat..near the Prudential Center,one can walk everywhere and the MTA is a block or two away.Lots of places to eat there..and a number of little cafes,grocery stores in the neighborhood. Rooms are on the small side,but I didnt expect more. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great stay, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of Copley House - I stayed here in July last year and loved it. I had no reservations about booking to stay there when I was in Boston again this year. In fact we ended up staying there twice on our vacation, once at the beginning before we left for our tour of New England and then once when we headed back into Boston just before we flew home. The first time we stayed for a few nights at a studio on West Newton Street, in the same building where I'd stayed last year. It was great - clean, comfortable and all the things I said in my last review of course still apply - great value for money, great location. The second time, we were in another building a few streets away, St Botolph Street I think it was. The accomodation was fine on the face of it, clean, comfortable and very spacious. But it was very noisy - I think it must be next to or back onto student accomodation, as I barely slept all night courtesy of thedrunken shouting and singing of groups of what sounded like university aged people. The place seriously needs soundproofing to stop noise outside the building coming in. Noise inside the building was a bit of an issue too, as after having finally got to sleep I then got woken up by the noise of the amorous activity of the people in the apartment upstairs... I would stay at Copley again as its value and location are great and I have had no problems with the standard of accomodatio at any timen. However, I would make sure I got a place on West Newton Street at this was very quiet and there were no noise issues here.

Reviews.Title: “The worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy25
Reviews.Content: OMG! This was disgraceful. The four of us arrived at Copley house only then to be driven to our dank studio, not 1 bedroom apartment as per our booking. The kids had to sleep on a single airbed, there was a hole in the floor in the bathroom. The room was so hot that we needed to keep aircon on, but that was so noisy so we didn't sleep at all. It wasn't only dated, it was way past its use by date. I see some good and bad reviews for this place her. From what I can determine it seems if you stay in the Copley House house then maybe that is good, but if they ship you to the one of the other properties beware. Maybe get in writing of which room you are booked in and actual photos of that room before you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: garrathroberts
Reviews.Content: We were shown to an apartment in the cellar of a building that was a block away from The Copley House. The apartment was disgusting to say the least. The room had not been made up, the carpet dirty, fixtures in a poor state of repair and extensive mold on the walls. All though we paid for parking, the spot allocated at the property was already taken and we had to park a block away outside the main building. Much time was wasted attempting to get the apartment made up. Whilst The Copley House is well located; we will not be using it again and do not consider it good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value - Brownstone on Residential Street - Green and Orange Lines”
Reviews.Author: oscargl1
Reviews.Content: One-half of a floor of a brownstone newly refurbished with kitchenette, separate bedroom, bathroom off the hall - NOT through the bedroom. Good fold-out sofabed, Excellent wide-screen TV with good cable. WIFI included. Walk easily to Green E subway, indoor shopping mall, and don't miss the easy walk to the Orange subway to the Samuel Adams Brewery Free tour !

Reviews.Title: “Do not under any circumstances stay here.”
Reviews.Author: GalTraveler047
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and pleasure, and this was one of the most awful hotel experiences I have had. The room was not ready when we arrived, even though we called earlier in the day to confirm the check in time/room availability. The room itself, "small studio" was located several blocks away from Copley House, and was a dank basement apartment. The web site photos do not at all represent what the apartment actually looks like. The furniture is old, mismatched, and needs repair. Parking is behind the building in an alley next to the garbage cans - with a $10.00 additional charge. There was mold growing on the bathroom walls and ceiling, the mildew odor in the apartment intself was covered by several sickly sweet smelling Glade Plug In's air fresheners in the outlets, the carpet was filthy (I did not want to take off my shoes), there was water damage to the ceiling and walls, the baseboard heater was falling off the wall, I can go on and on. To add insult to injury, there was no hot water, so we had cold showers in the morning. Although we knew we were not staying at The Four Seasons, we deserved so much better quality for the price of $135.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: LeitrimGuy
Reviews.Content: Great location 2 mins walk from nearest subway (Prudential) & easy access to downtown Boston. One bedroom appartment with bed sofa in living area comfortably accomated 3 of us (would have done 4) & kitchen facility give chice of eating in or out. Price very reasonable and if you want good, if basic, accomodation rather than high priced hotels - this place is spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Low Key and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: LJ_Herzog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Copley House for two nights and were very happy with our experience. The "hotel" is really a set of brownstone apartment buildings within a few blocks in the Back Bay area. Probably not the best choice if you have special needs or are expecting the traditional hotel experience but for an active couple travelling on a budget, it can't be beat. Though we only stayed a few nights, this place would be great for a longer stay because our room had a kitchenette with a full sized fridge. It is within walking distance of Fenway Park and Northeastern Univ. and our building was less than a block from the closest T station. Overall, very homey and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Irishlass84
Reviews.Content: copley house is in a great location.. just two mins walk to nearest shop to get ur bits (bread milk etc). less than 5 mins walk to the Prudential centre & subway station. from here you can get anywhere in boston in no time. the house itself is an old building. no complaints though. was clean, comfortable & airconditioned. what more do you need

Reviews.Title: “The Aloha Spirit of Copley House & Its Staff”
Reviews.Author: johngabr
Reviews.Content: Hello: A few weeks ago, I traveled to Boston to visit friends and family, and needed a place to stay close to Back Bay. Although it was the height of the tourist season, the Copley House and its staff were able to accomodate me with last minute notice. I'm grateful to them for doing so. Having secured an affordable booking into one of their comfortable studio apartments on West Newton Street, I was able to come and go as I pleased, and was happy to be able to have accomodation which would allow me to some independent cooking, allowing me to entertain friends. The studio was well equipped in this regard, with ample dishes, cookware, and other necessary items, which made me feel as if I were in my own home. Upon arrival, I was warmly greeted by Joe Coppola, the proprietor of Copley House, and Ritza, his very adept manager. This was not my first time staying at the Copley House, and I felt happy that I was remembered by both Joe and Ritza. The studio apartment that I rented was bright, sunny, clean, and affordable for my budget, given the fact that I am a teacher. Without hesitation, I highly recommend Copley House to anyone planning to stay in the Boston area for any length of time. A high thumbs up here, from a Hawai`i resident who values the spirit of Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Oh Stop this place is fine”
Reviews.Author: cool4august88
Reviews.Content: My experience was great and I would return! Iv been to some of the nicest resorts and I wasnt scared of this place like others stated. yes it is out dated but its an old historical building My husband and I enjoyed the charm and got to see what it was like to live in Boston! They seemed to be updating because our bathroom was brand new/beautiful. they even saved us a parking place! My opinion snobs don't stay here but great price location clean for all others!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, dirty.”
Reviews.Author: jedwards_10
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd save get out of the conference center mall and enjoy nearby Back Bay. I picked the wrong hotel. Dirty, stained rugs. Finish worn off the wood furniture, so my clothes snagged and got splinters. No staff on the scene in the evening or morning when i was coming or going. Best things: proximity to nice walking path, and good A.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but average stay”
Reviews.Author: saj26
Reviews.Content: It a great location 2 mins walk from Prudential center and copley place. Stay was ok, i would say its a very average place. Its true what you pay is what you get, but for this price i would recommend to stay at such a location.

Reviews.Title: “Where's my reservation?”
Reviews.Author: MarylandTraveler25
Reviews.Content: The room was fine - clean enough, with a small-but-new television and a decent air conditioner. But my reservation was completely mishandled, and the service we received in trying to straighten it out left plenty to be desired. I was traveling with two colleagues; we were all arriving at different times, but were all on the same reservation, which apparently completely disappeared. When my boss checked in, he was able to straighten it out -- he thought. But when I showed up hours later, they a) had no record of him checking in, and then b) gave me a key to his room. I only discovered this because I had to walk three blocks to my building and met him on the street on the way there. They put me in a different building for the night and then made me change rooms the next day. Since I was in town for a convention, I didn't get back until midnight, at which point I had to phone several times to find someone who would let me in.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best of stays, it was the worst of stays.”
Reviews.Author: PittsburghHiptripper
Reviews.Content: The good - location on a quiet street of townhouses, it was clean, it had a good new TV, the bed was comfortable. There was a small deck (Apt. 211). Free WiFi and local phone calls. I did not use the kitchen. The bad - ad does not say you will have to walk 3 blocks and perhaps climb up to third floor. Furniture and rug were stained, slats in blinds were broken, screen on patio door was off. I had to reset closet doors into track. Window frames were rotting, peeling, screwed shut. The one night I needed AC, it did not work. The emergency number gave no help. The rate was higher than the ad indicated.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NEIT-Student
Reviews.Content: First impressions count. Receptionist was busy eating at her desk when I arrived. Check-in forms strewn over her desk. Check-in was OK, but then was taken to the end of the street and given an address in an adjoining street. This was not a short distance away, but 3 blocks! The room was a bedsit, the furniture old and stained, the bedroom unbelievably small. The wallpaper was peeling and there were holes in them (the walls). There has been no attempt at renovation/updating in about 30 years. For the money this place is a ripoff. The final straw came when I realized I'd left my phone charger behind and called their reception he same day I checked out, but only got their voicemail service. I told them I would return in 2 weeks to collect. hen I called in, guess what? yes the receptionist had his takeout meal half eaten in front of him. No one seemed to have a clue. The senior assistant said they had no procedure for lost property, but then said they usually posted out! This hotel is the pits and you should avoid at all costs. I sure wish I'd taken some photos no one would want to stay, especially at the prices they're charging.

Reviews.Title: “"You get what you pay for"”
Reviews.Author: ramblingrose1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in small studio. Located in the lower floor along with 3 other units. In iniitial unit, the landline phone did not work and could not get service on cell. Furnishings were dated, armchair was stained and old (ugh), coffeemaker obviously unused for a long period with old stains in the water well, dining table chair seats were sunken. Unit large for a small but bathroom was miniature. Took two days for response regarding phone line. Finally moved to adjacent small unit which was much better appointed, furnishings were newer, pictures on wall, cleaner appearance and a working phone and cell phone servcie access. Neither unit resembled photos on web site those much more attractive and appealing. These units on St. Botolph. Would not recommend if end up with the first small unit. It is reminiscent of a space where unwanted furniture would be stored/placed. Second unit was better and appropriate for the price of app. $120/nite in Boston. Limited housekeeping services. More in line with motel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: HarleyCa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights while we were in Boston. While the location was good - in a cute neighborhood and close to the subway- we were disappointed with the cleanliness and general upkeep in the apartment that we were in. While the size of the apartment was sufficient, the bathroom was dirty and the mattress was old and sagged in the middle. The decor of Room 109 was furnished in what looked like second-hand pieces of furniture that were badly banged up. We were also disappointed with the staff. We seemed to have a different person in the front office each day -- while polite, none were helpful with our questions.

Reviews.Title: “It's like staying at a friends apartment while they're away”
Reviews.Author: ladybug403
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston this month checking out colleges with my little sis. We had the pleasure of staying at the Copley House. You can't get a better location than West Newton Street. Talk about a gorgeous neighborhood, beautiful brownstones and everything you need just a short walk away! Copley House really is in the Center of it all. The T (Prudential) was a 1-2 minute walk away, a HUGE upscale mall as well as the famous Newbury Street and every restaurant and nightlife amenity you can imagine. Now the room itself was clean, functional, secure and pleasant. The beds were cozy and the staff quite accommodating to our requests and knowledgeable about what there is to do in the area. The kitchenette is also great because we didn't have to eat every meal out which saved us some $$$ to spend on all the shopping (Saks AND Barneys next door!) we tried to squeeze in. All in all, it was a great trip. This is not the Four Seasons (that IS just down a ways though I recommend going there for tea!) but it convenient, clean and the cost fit our budget. It made us feel like we had a home base to go to after a action-packed day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant spot, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: traveller165
Reviews.Content: We found the Copley House to be a pleasant spot, conveniently located in the Back Bay area, close to a number of 'T' stations. The room was clean, well appointed, with a kitchen area and bathroom. Staff were very helpful and did not hesitate to provide assistance - particularly when we needed to amend our booking on arrival. We would recommend the Copley House.

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodging, for Great Value”
Reviews.Author: johngabr
Reviews.Content: Hello: When I do go back to Boston to visit friends (I used to be a resident) I always stay at the Copley House, due to its highly convenient location and low lodging costs. The Copley House has great amenities, one of which are the fully-equipped kitchens, where you can save $ by cooking your own meals. There is a supermarket nearby, in addition to a variety of other shopping venues; you just can't beat the location. Given the fact that the Back Bay is one of Boston's most exclusive neighborhoods, the stay at the Copley is real affordable, and totally comfortable. I highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Boston who desires a clean, comfortable, safe, friendly, and affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: AlVal3
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I went to Boston to visit our daughter in Boston, and stayed at the Copley House for one night. It's actually not a house but a collection of apartments in several row houses all within a few blocks of each other. We had reserved a suite room on the 3rd floor of one of the 2 Newton Street buildings. When we arrived (after driving 7 hours) we were told the room had already been "assigned" but we were given another in a building on St Stephen St. Well, the room was nothing like the website prictures. It was 1970s decor, worn by 30 years or so. Light bulbs were dead, tiles loose in the bathroom, the toilet seat coming off, etc. It reminded me of my edge of Brooklyn Heights apartment, circa 1975. That's not a compliment. I only wish I thought to take a few pictures. Don't be fooled about the parking. It is not included, unless you know the owner or the place is empty. The Manager did take the parking fee I paid for a garage a few blocks off the tab after I complained. I commented about the condition of the apartment when checking out and the bait and switch routine. I was told I'd get an email regarding my issues. I'm still waiting. The 1 plus was the location, in Back Bay. But unless you're on a recent college grad budget, spring the extra cash for a real hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! And that's not good!”
Reviews.Author: Rockshire
Reviews.Content: Upon check in, we were escorted by foot to an apartment on St. Botolph St. Dreadfully filthy carpet greeted us in the foyer and the studio apartment we would call home for five nights. Thankfully, everything else was clean. It was furnished with odds and ends pieces of furniture. Although we didn't use them, the studio was supplied with frig, microwave, toaster oven, and coffee pot. We did use the iron. The location was excellent to Prudential Center and subway station. I would not choose this management company again but would look for another company that pays more attention to the upkeep of its properties.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing beats this for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: BogotaMaria
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Copley House with my mother (85) and two teenage children in June of this year. After reading the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor I was a bit apprehensive about what we might find. However, although we had a couple of small problems at first (room on third floor with no elevator, which was a problem for my mother, and not too confortable mattress on sofa-bed), the staff, and particularly Ritza, were marvelous. They helped us out in every way: we were moved to a very nice one-bedroom apartment the day after our arrival and the mattress was changed not once but twice, until we found one that was suitable. We were also provided with an air mattress at no extra cost for one of the kids. In short, nothing beats having your own apartment, at an excellent location and for a very affordable rate. I would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LouLouLouey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 5 nights. We were there for 4th July weekend and so booked months in advance. At the time we made the booking, I saw that there were a lot of negative reviews on TripAdvisor about this place so I was wary about making a reservation here. However, we needed an apartment/place with its own cooking facilities and I could only find two such places in Boston that matched our modest budget. (The other place we considered only offered 7 night stays or more, so no good for us). However, I needn't have worried, and I see now that the more recent reviews on Trip Advisor (2009) are much more positive than earlier reviews. I don't know if this is because Copley House has got its act together recently, or the earlier reviewers were the type of people who want the moon on a stick, or both. But we really liked our apartment. Its not the Hilton - everything was a little on the old side and the decor is pretty basic and homely as opposed to modern. But our 'small studio' was actually quite spacious, it was very clean and all the kitchen applicances etc worked fine. The bed was very comfortable too. The location was great - we were in a building on West Newton St - I understand that Copley House also has apartments in buildings on nearby streets. The street we stayed in was quiet and very nice, the sort of leafy and brownstone-lined street in Boston I'd love to live on. It was about 2-3 minute walk to the T (subway) stop, which gets you into the downtown/Park St/Government Center area in about 15 minutes. The T is right at the Prudential Center which has a great shopping and views (if you pay to go the observation deck at the top, which I recommend). West Newton Street is also just a few minutes walk away from Copley Square, Newbery Street and its a 20 minute walk to Fenway Park too. We are already planning our next trip to Boston and we will be staying with Copley House again. I have given this a review of 4/5 because the accomodation was a little on the old/basic side in terms of decor, otherwise I would have given it 5. But overall given its location this place represents amazing value for money, considering the rates charged for rooms/apartments elsewhere in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, value for money, and a very cordial service”
Reviews.Author: musclenut
Reviews.Content: This is the only place i would recommend my friends and family to stay when they visit Boston. Apartments provide all the necessary amenities and more at a value offering while the service continues to be truly cordial and accomodating. Ritza Cornet, the Rental Manager, was especially wonderful. She personifies these apartments and make us feel a home away from home. Moreover, location can't be beat. But, parking was a bit of a pain. Overall, a very rewarding experience.

Reviews.Title: “great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: ThomNZ
Reviews.Content: Great location, very quiet and pretty. The room we had was downstairs, so the windows were a little under pavement level however we had a full kitchen and plenty of space. The staff were sometimes in the office, sometimes were just around and we found weren't too much help. The room was clean and the building was great however it would have been good if we had a choice of a room upstairs, or were told that the room we booked was below ground level. Overall was good, clean and reasonably priced with a great location to base our day trips from

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Back Bay Location”
Reviews.Author: altermood
Reviews.Content: As most people know who are either going to visit boston or have visited boston already, the hotels there are outrageously expensive. Copley house is actually a great alternative. They offer self-catering apartments in an excellent location. When we first got to the office, which is in a beautiful back bay location on West Newton Street, we were told that they had four different properties and they had upgraded us from a small studio to a medium studio, free of charge, which was at their location on St. Stephens st., a few blocks away. When we got to the place, we found out that we were in a basement studio in a great, little building on a beautiful street, near many of the places that we wanted to go to. Despited being a "basement" studio, we really weren't underground and the place actually had it's own private backyard, which was nice, even though we never did use it. The only drawback was the noise. We could hear the water dripping from upstairs constantly, but it wasn't a big deal for us. Some people might get really bothered by these kinds of things, but we realize that when we are travelling, things are bound to happen and for 120 dollars a night, we had absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with kitchen, nice neighborhood, good price with cheap parking.”
Reviews.Author: moomoo455
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms with a kitchen in nice, old, charming buildings near Berklee College of Music. If you can get a parking spot it's only $10/night - a great deal in Boston. May be able to negotiate a better price if booking several rooms or coming back for another stay. I have stayed in two other places (hotel and B&B) in Boston near Berklee and this one is the best place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: fraggles1975
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at Copley House for 3 nights from the 8th to 10th April. We stayed in 239 West Newton Street in room 105 (Bedroom plus sofa bed). The room itself was very cozy and homely, the kitchen was well equipped with the basics we needed to be able to have breakfast every morning and a cup of tea. The room was warm , the bed was comfy and the bathroom was clean. My only observations would be the room itself could do with a few basic DIY jobs completing and the hallway outside the room looked like it hadn't been hoovered for at least a week. We had a problem with the TV asked the front desk if they could have a look at it and they finally got round to fixing it on the last night we were there as we happened to catch the maintenance man on the stairs. Other niggle was we had to leave for a flight in the morning, we left arount 7.30 and there was nobody downstairs to to give the key too or a box to drop it in, in the end we left it on the hallway shelf with a note and hoped for the best. All in all the apartment was very close to an underground stop (5 mins walk) Duck boat tours was just round the corner and a shopping centre. After reading the mixed reviews on the site and not knowing what to expect it was perfectly fine what what we needed and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: beth01dfw
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the Ritz, the Copley House isn't it. BUT...the amazing price, the spectacular location, and the accommodating staff make this a real diamond in the rough. Yes, they could do some more updating at the Copley House, but I know that would drive the prices close to the competing hotels. Personally, I prefer the affordable cost, amiable and VERY accommodating staff, convenience of a kitchenette, extra room, and fantastic location. It was clean, comfortable and convenient. That's what I'm looking for. Sure, when I meet my rich Prince Charming, I probably will stay at the Ritz (because I really want to be spoiled and the walls are incredibly thin at Copley House), but for now, the Copley House really gets my vote. Happy travels in Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Extended Family Gathering”
Reviews.Author: PerthMog
Reviews.Content: Above average FOR THE PRICE in such a safe, CENTRAL location. We booked 8 units for family members coming from across the US, Australia, Europe and the Middle East. At the time of booking (directly with The Copley House), we requested emailed photos of the rooms reserved for us, as a record. The BEST part of our stay was having so many family members in close accommodation for such a happy occasion as a wedding, being able to meet all together in one room for a drink, or to share a meal. Looking back, this meant far more than the standard of the accommodation - a waste to spend more for fancy rooms when our holiday was about visiting with family members separated by long distances (and airfares), and seeing Boston. Downside and Upside points listed below. Downside: 1. The rooms we were assigned on arrival did not always correspond with the photo shown, as had been agreed on booking. 2. The carpets were in need of a good clean and did not get vacuumed at all that we noticed. 3. Not a full complement of cutlery in some kitchens, nor was it very clean. Housekeeping needs to learn to wash dishes hygienically. 4. Rooms were overheated and temperature not adjustable, so we had to have the windows open. 5. Shower stall drained very slowly only in at least 1 studio. 6. Pull out bed mattresses uncomfortable in some studios. 7. We were told there was a 'short' flight of stairs down to the room reserved for a 94 yo - in fact, 2 very steep flights. Would not meet requisite standards for people with disabilities or the very elderly in my country. Upside: 1. Excellent location. 2. The staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. 3. Complaints were dealt with promptly such as: room change to one similar to photo; lumpy springless mattress thrown out and replaced with a new one... 4. Bathrooms were cleaned daily, fresh towels daily. 5. We had free parking for 2 weeks. 6. We kept our rooms at a much reduced rate when we were away for a night. 7. Studio was bright, well appointed with furniture, beds comfortable, linen clean. 8. Laundromat across the street, supermarket nearby.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marc-i-tect
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this place by my company's travel agent, and I wish that she had checked into it first...but it was probably the last room downtown available, and THE WORST I have ever experinced.. I'll try to be brief and just give a list of the strikes against...but there are many: *It's not a hotel. It's a series of row house properties that have been shoddily renovated into apartments at some point in time, then not taken care of AT ALL since. *Tiny dingy shabby Kitchenette, I wouldn't eat anything prepared in it. *Tiny dingy shabby bathroom. *Tub would not drain, so you get to stand in dirty water when showering. *Dingy shabby carpet. *Horribly uncomfortable mattress...seemingly picked up out of a nearby alley. *Supposed wireless internet did not work. *Walls so thin you can hear conversations in the next unit like they are sitting next to you...literally. *NO HEAT!!! Only until the middle of the night, then they shut it off to save $. This was not a one-time temporary thing. I called to complain and was told they'd have someone look into whether the heat was broken. I asked why there are no controls for the heat, and was told that the renters don't pay the utility bills, so why should they control them? I went ballistic, then was offered $50 cash for the inconvenience. Then they called back to lie and said that it had been fixed...but the same thing happened every night after I went to bed...about 55 degrees in the AM. Then I realized they knew there was nothing wrong with the heat, and never sent anyone to fix it...they just didn't have it on! If there was anything else available I would have went running away. I don't understand how anyone could have such low standards as to give this place a positive review as a few have, unless you have been homeless in the past...perhaps it's from the management. SAVE YOURSELF!!!

Reviews.Title: “pass this one up folks”
Reviews.Author: yeehaw411
Reviews.Content: Arrived as scheduled, checked in and pre-paid as required. Then was told that "wait a minute, those rooms were cancelled" to which I replied "no way did I cancel them". They tried to put us ( 4 adults ) in ONE CRACKERBOX SIZED ROOM with a full size bed and a small sofa sleeper. We went back to the office ( several blocks away ), got our credit card credited back and thankfully The Copley House took us to another hotel in Boston, but we had to pay considerably more for those rooms... but it was ultimately worth it. IF you are going to chance it with these folks you'd better make sure, several times, that they have not screwed up your reservation; before you leave your home and head for Boston, call them one last time and make sure you still have the reservation secured. Maybe then you will enjoy your time at The Copley House. While dealing with the office people I watched several other customers come in with complaints; whether they were satisfactorily taken care of, who knows, but the fact is, there were too many complaints going on all at the same time. The Copley House needs to completely revamp their approach to reservations and providing for their customers. Maybe we just caught them in a bad time, I don't know, but my sense of things was that our selection of The Copley House was a bad selection from the get-go. If you can afford to go somewhere else you'll probably save yourself some headaches.

Reviews.Title: “With more effort could be great”
Reviews.Author: ethanEngland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a basement, medium sized apartment for five nights. The location was behind the Philharmonic Hall. Most of the other houses in the area had been converted into apartments, many inhabited by students. The apartment had a kitchen, which was very handy for cooking some meals. The furniture was of a good standard. On the whole we enjoyed our stay for the price we paid which was much cheaper than nearby hotels. What let the apartment down was that it needed a good top class painter to give it a good finish, and a general makeover. On our second morning we awoke to the sound of water coming through the ceiling. Luckily the leak was above the sink and the water all went into it, and only lasted a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Finance_Guru
Reviews.Content: Stayed in unit 402 - small studio - and it was the actual place on the website pictures! The pics made it look bigger but no complaints on the size. Everything was clean and worked fine. Desk service was very helpful. Gave us a parking place (extra charge of $10/night) that was right out the back door of the building. Note that parking is "first come, first served" so it may not be available! Fresh towels and room cleaned up everyday (something we did not plan on getting). Kitchen was well equiped and dishes / pots clean. Excellent place to stay in Boston for the price and 3 minute walk to Prudential Center (restaurants/shops/groceries/subway).

Reviews.Title: “Best Rate-Value in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Nadooori
Reviews.Content: I dont think that there is any better value than the copley house. Rates are very reasonable in very expensive copley place in Boston. Rooms are spacious and clean with nice furniture. Location is just a two minute walk to the financial area of Boston. I'd recomment this hotel for everyone going to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: NaBeau
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a wonderful stay at the Copley House. We had a beautiful view that overlooked the Copley area. We are in walking distance (5 min) to the Prudential Center, which has many fine shops and restaurants. The staff was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: jr0316
Reviews.Content: From the previous reviews, it seems like rooms at Copley House can be very hit or miss, but I was quite pleased with my room at the property. I booked a medium studio (Room 104 at 215 W. Newton) not knowing exactly what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised to find a larger than average room with a new flat screen TV. The kitchen was fully stocked with utensils and cookware and had pretty much anything you would need to cook your own meals (minus the food, of course). The bathroom was clean and stocked with towels, and the rest of the room was clean as well. Now for the drawbacks...the bed certainly wasn't the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in, but it didn't negatively affect my sleeping habits. The room I stayed in also faced the street, so any street noise could be heard, but it wasn't any louder than average. The hallway was also slightly dingy, and one minor complaint was that the blinds didn't reach all the way to the bottom of the window sill, as the room had windows that were quite tall. Other than that, I would definitely stay at Copley House again and recommend it to anyone needing a place to stay in Boston. The location is very hard to beat, especially for the price, as it is a few short blocks to all the shopping and the T at Prudential Center. And for a New Yorker like me who is used to walking, it's a short walk to Newbury Street and many other sites in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Copley House”
Reviews.Author: LAVIO
Reviews.Content: We've just come back home (in Montreal, Canada) from a three-night stay at Copley House, in Boston. This place is in a very nice sector of Boston, close to public transportation and all the major hotels and the business area. First of all, you should know that the pictures on the Copley House website are pretty misleading. Actually, theyâ€™re very misleading! We â€“ my wife and two kids â€“ had booked a one-room unit, which is supposed to be the most luxurious one they have. Ouch! If you donâ€™t mind the missing paint on the walls, the moldy smell, the dirty carpets, the so-so beds and sofa beds, and the slimy showers (just to name a few â€œfeaturesâ€�), go ahead and ask for unit 100 in the basement of the 239 West Newton Street building... right next to the laundry room!! That being said, when we saw our unit, we asked to be moved and were given two separate rooms for the first night (11 & 14-year-old kids weren't too happy about sleeping in a different room that their parents, but it was better that being in the basement...), we then had to go back to our smelly basement on the second night, and we were given a nice one-bedroom unit for our third and last night. Thatâ€™s a lot of moving around for such a short trip! We were in Boston with a few other people who stayed in another building (first floor of St. Stephen Street building), and their rooms were fine. I think Iâ€™d go back to the Copley House because of its affordable prices and its tremendous location, but I would ask for specific rooms, i.e. rooms 104 (which has been completely renovated and which is very nice) and room 109 (a one-bedroom unit) in the 239 West Newton Street building. I would also stay away from room 103 (and 100 of course) in this same building. While I wasnâ€™t too impressed with the Copley House, I must say that the staff were all VERY helpful, understanding and accommodating. I really appreciate what they did to make our stay more enjoyable. Finally, they gave me a substantial rebate, which was also greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely sucked!”
Reviews.Author: TravelABCAlbany
Reviews.Content: I just recently spent 4 nights at Copley House. While the location is great and at first look the room with kitchenette was cute, it turned out that only half the lights worked, the covers over the radiators fell off, there was paint missing on a large section of the bathroom wall and best of all, the sink stopper in the bathroom was stuck making the sink unusable. Two days and three complaints later, someone finally fixed it. At $200 a night that is outrageously bad service. When I got back home, I realized that they had double charged the room to my credit card. One e-mail, two phone calls and three days later they are supposedly going to take it off later today. I believe that when I see it...

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: shelca
Reviews.Content: We have used Copley House for years to house business colleagues for extended stays--many of them come back for just a couple nights and insist on staying there again! They have several apartment buildings located in Boston's vibrant South End, close to public transportation, shopping, restaurants, and sites. Each unit has a kitchenette, a must for those in the city for several weeks at a time. The owners are super friendly and always available to help out. Whenever I drop someone off, I wish I could live there all the time!

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare Don't Stay There!”
Reviews.Author: lisatravels12345
Reviews.Content: We booked this place thinking it would be nice, but it turned out to be a nightmare. The first day we checked in we were brought to another building down the street. The apartment was falling apart. Water leaking under the sink and the awful smell of an animal having stayed there. They should warn people that pets stay in there rooms because my allergies acted up and I could not sleep. The refrigerator made noise, the toilet ran, the tiles in the bathroom were cracked, water stains on the ceiling. This place had the worst maintenance ever! Not to mention the noises of the people staying next door. Loud street noise etc. etc

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother if staying at 239 W. Newton #501”
Reviews.Author: ASH5
Reviews.Content: The place we stayed in was considered a med. size studio apartment. It had a bed, mini kitchen, table , and bathroom. The price was reasonable and the area was cute, and near public transportation. However, it smelled like burnt popcorn, and the carpet was really dirty. I did not feel like it was clean. We stayed two nights because we had to everything else was booked.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful neighborhood, great value”
Reviews.Author: marcia_marcia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous section of Boston. It is just blocks from the Prudential Center, Newbury Street, and very short walk to two different T stops, (Prudential on green line, and Back Bay on Orange line). In a quiet neighborhood of beautiful brownstones and a walking path to that orange line stop, it is a very safe area. We were warmly greeted and treated well at check in. We had a studio in the building on Newton St, which was very quiet. The room was small, but very clean and we really enjoyed having a kitchen. There were many wonderful resturants nearby on Tremont St. and a huge grocery at the Prudential complex. My traveling companion and I thought that this was a great value and we would recommend this hotel to our friends and will stay there again when visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Copley House Is Not A Good Experience. Avoid”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLINGALONE068
Reviews.Content: The place is like a frat house. Doors slam, people crash up and down the stairs all night. The bathroom seemed to be falling apart. I just wanted out.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: stanjo
Reviews.Content: I am writing the review to save others from an awful experience. First, we booked the room expecting and I am quoting the man on the phone, "A charming apartment" . However, there is little charming about being marched off to a different building with our suitcases and dumped off in a smelly room. I will list the problems . The room smelled like an old wet dog. My allergies went crazy because someone obviously had a pet in the room. The bathroom had broken tile, mold on the wall and the toilet was disgusting. The kitchen had old rodent traps around the refrigerator and stove. This apartment looked like someone fixed up an old closet or garage and threw a bed in there. Do not make our mistake,changing hotels last second in Boston is impossible. Book somewhere else in advance. We were forced to stay here because every other hotel was sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelerfun
Reviews.Content: The pictures and description of this place are VERY misleading. We arrived at the place to find that the office was closed with a sign "Be back in 5 minutes." 30 minutes later, a young guy returned to inform us our room was 2 blocks down the road. After lugging our suitcases in the pouring rain down to the other building and up three flights of stairs, we opened the door to find a cold, wet and dirty apartment. Upon entry, we found 3 garbage cans strategically placed throughout the unit, collecting drippage from a leaking ceiling. When this was brought to the manager's attention, he made no effort to apologize or to provide any compensation. The bedding was mismatched, the furniture ragged and nothing about the place was warm and inviting. It was like staying over in a complete stranger's dirty apartment. The location is great, but NOT worth it. And beware of being charged more than what you were quoted online. Don't be fooled by the quaint images and description online: ANY PLACE in Boston is better than this!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuyChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property from 5/19/07-5/26/07. Initially, they put me in a building at 41 St. Stephen Street. You don't want this one. The neighborhood is a little risky at night, and walls are paper thin. I was in a basement studio. Even though there was just a single woman staying in the apartment above me, it sounded like an elephant strolling about every time she moved. The room was dirty; it looked as if the the venetian blinds hadn't been cleaned in 10 years, also no A/C and 2 of the 3 windows did not open. I complained after 2 nights and was moved to a better apartment at 215 W. Newton. My only problem here was the traffic noise on the street outside, but it is the cental city and I live in a very quiet neighborhood....just not used to that. This apartment was much cleaner, had 12-foot ceilings, and an excellent A/C unit, which is important, seeing as how it was in the low 90s during part of my stay. Ritza, Jonathan, and Nelson on-staff were all accommodating and pleasant, particularly Ritza. Bottom line, if you are looking for reasonably priced accommodations at the edge of Back Bay, this is a decent property, just make sure you are in one of the buildings on Newton Street, you don't want St. Stephens.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, neat - great way to experience an apartment in a different city”
Reviews.Author: thehoosiergirl
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel - it IS an apartment in a VERY quaint section of the city! I was lodged into a unit on Botolph street - older building, steep staircases, walls with areas that needed to be patched - but clean. My stay was pleasant and reasonable. When I started looking for rooms I found out there were 4+ college graduations going on that weekend - I think this is why the rate was more than what other had posted (I paid $139/nite). Overall, a good experience. The apartment was a one bedroom with nice views of the neighborhood. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom, kitchen was nicely equipped. Much more spacious than a traditional hotel room and really gives you the feel of living in a different city! I could hear street noise and convos of people walking down the street. Furniture appeared to be second hand castoffs - but all of this just added to it's charm :0) EXCELLENT location - 5 blocks from the Prudential center and it's shopping, Newbury street and all of it's quaint shops, very close to the magnificent library and the churches that surround it (check out the toroise and haire statue in the Trinity courtyard). I walked all the way to the wharf from the apartment - picking up bits and pieces of the Freedom Trail along the way. *Note there is a huge Shaw's grocery just past the Prudential complex that has a wonderful hot and cold deli section and an enormous ethnic food section - great for utlizing that kitchen space! I would consider staying here again - If you choose to, be forewarned to get SPECIFIC instructions of which way to go when you exit the "T" stop - i wandered for quite some time in the rain, dragging my suitcase bcuz the "T" worker had never heard of Newton Street.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - Rate Scam”
Reviews.Author: wellpaidscientist
Reviews.Content: I made an on-line reservation for $70 per night plus tax. I called the hotel the next day to find out check-in times, and was told at that time they were not honoring the rate I had reserved. They were more than happy to reserve me a room for $120 per night plus tax. The employee said "they were going to call me" to let me know my rate was nearly doubling. Yeah, right. I had my cell phone with me all day, they never even tried. I'm sure they were hoping I would show up and agree to pay almost double to avoid being on the street. If you want to get ripped off by a hotel with no business ethics, then by all means, stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers USA Style”
Reviews.Author: DaveSNo9
Reviews.Content: If you find yourself in the sister property 215 W. Newton ... run like hell and don't stop until you reach the Marriott. Every time someone uses water in the building there is a resulting bang when the taps are turned off. On one night I didn't get to sleep until 1.30pm and was woken up at 5.00am! I checked out on the third day (and it only took me that long because I was busy working and no-one is in the office before 9.20am or after 7.00pm). The room cleaning is also shabby. The cleaner came intio my room and merely covered the bed with the top sheet to make it look as though it had been changed. If they had done nothing it wouldn't have bothered me, but to pretend.... This place is a nightmare ... unless you have very low standards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Aparments, will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: ichoi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Copley House Apartment for 4 nights in Oct, 06. I was put into the apartments on Botolph St. , about 2 minute walk from the main reception in Newton St. The apartment was very clean and extremely spacious. The neighbourhood is well kept and safe--no need to worry if you have to walk back late at night. The receptionists were friendly and helpful. Maid service is ok, they come and collect the rubbish everyday, sometimes they make the bed as well. I have paid $145+tax per night for my aparment, I think it is well worth it! (considering all the nearby hotels charge over $200 a night) I am glad that I stayed in Copley House, will definitely stay there again next time I return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: seattlehousewife
Reviews.Content: Just visited Boston with my husband and 6 year old son. Initially, I was a little concerned about staying at the Copley House instead of one of the large hotel chains. Glad I decided to go ahead and book my stay at this hotel! It was clean, quiet, comfortable, and a great deal- about half of what the other hotels in the area were charging! We stayed in a one bedroom, which was pretty good sized and included a kitchenette. The Copley is close to everything, and if I come back to Boston I would absolutely not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: katen
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights as a friend and I were in the city for a concert. I spoke to 3 different staff members between the time of booking and arrival and found them all to be extremely pleasant and helpful. The location was perfect and only about a 4 minute walk to the Prudential T. The tree-lined street was comprised of brownstones, making you feel not as a visitor but more of a resident. 7-11 was conveniently 2 blocks away, and lively Boylston St. is only about a 7 minute walk. If you need parking, request it at the time of booking as they have a limited number of spots. At only $10/night, it was a bargain compared to the usual $30+ for the garages. The studio itself was about $105/night (for Friday/Saturday!!) We arrived at our room to find our air conditioning not working. One of the staff members went out of his way to insure we were taken care of. Maintenance did not come until the following morning to replace it, however we were given another "cool" room to sleep in that night. This is not the Ritz, so don't expect fancy, high quality accomodations. The rooms are well worn and could be a bit cleaner, but if you're just looking for a place to sleep at night, it can't be beat. What you WILL get is friendly and accomodating staff, a great location, and superb value. Having stayed at a different hotel each of my many Boston stays, I will gladly repeat Copley House in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Copley House,great value.”
Reviews.Author: Frankn
Reviews.Content: Just back from Boston having stayed at Copley House. OK its not the Ritz but you could not get a better location at the price i.e. $140 a nite.Basic accom. very clean, kitchen very well equipped. The T (use it ,its great 4 getting around) is just down the street at the Prudential center. Would recommend no problem.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place was full of young unsupervised students partying and playing music all night. This is not a great place for families. The accomodations are shabby and have not been updated in years.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Copley House is a complete scam! We were told the accomodations would be comfortable and near to the Marriot. However, when we arrived we were told the room would not be ready until 4pm. Furthermore,we were later carted off to another location further away. The room had an extremely outdated bathroom with a shabby kitchen setup at best. This place seemed more like a flop house with students nearby making noises all thru the night. Avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Handy for T station,shopping centers in walking distance. Really nice people on hand to help

HotelInfo.Name: Copley House
HotelInfo.Address: 239 West Newton St., Boston, MA 02116
